intro: Hesperis deltodea, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant features bright yellow flowers arranged in a single, flat-topped inflorescence, typically blooming in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hesperis deltodea is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
